t: To the Chief Musician. On an eight-stringed harp. A Psalm of David.
Help,*pn Lord,*s for the godly man ceases! For*ld the faithful disappear from among the sons of men.
They*ld speak idly everyone with his neighbor; With*ild flattering lips and*i a double heart they speak.
May*ln the Lord*s cut off all flattering lips, And*ild the tongue that speaks proud things,
Who*ld have said, “With*ld our tongue we will prevail; Our*ld lips are*i our own; Who*ld is*i lord over us?”
“For*ln the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, Now*ld I will arise,” says the Lord;*s “I*ld will set him*i in the safety for which he yearns.”
The*ln words of the Lord*s are*i pure words, Like*ild silver tried in a furnace of earth, Purified*ld seven times.
You*ld shall keep them, O Lord,*s You*ld shall preserve them from this generation forever.
The*ln wicked prowl on every side, When*ld vileness is exalted among the sons of men.
